title: Introduction to Redux — Core Principles
content:
Definition:
Redux is a predictable state container based on three principles:
– Single store
– State is read-only
– Changes made via pure functions (reducers)

Use:
Used for large-scale apps needing centralized state.

Importance:
Predictability, debugging, scalability.

Major Use & Advantages:
Useful in authentication, dashboards, complex data flows.
